resources.string: Information in this application should not necessarily be relied upon and should not to be construed to be professional advice from us. We do not guarantee the accuracy or completeness of any of the information provided, and is not responsible for any loss resulting from your reliance on such information.
Hydromaster should be used as a guide only when determining the water intake.
Excerise cause you to lose water and salts from you body that need replacing.
Your weight is a big factor in determining how much water you should drink and is used as a base line on which other factors are taken into account.

Using the configuration screen you can define different variables which effect the amount of you should be drinking. Below is a break down of how each element effects the amount of water you should drink.
The goal of Hydromaster is get people thinking about water, and how much they should be drinking a day.
Do not show this message again
How do I increase my water intake?
Can water help me lose weight?
Simply click on the glass to log that you have drank a glass of water. You can see how close you are to reaching your hydration target as the glass fills.
This screen shows how much water you should be drinking today and allows you to mark off when you have drank a glass.
If you need help with any of the features of Hydromaster just click the question mark at the top of each page. The relative help section will be displayed for you.
Here you can see how much water you have been drinking daily. This shows the logged water drank for each day. Use the filter at the top of the page to show use or more days.
Note the water you have drank will only show here if you have either saved the daily total from the hydrate log screen or have the \'automatically\' save water option checked in the settings screen

This screen shows you a break down of how the different factors make up your daily water total. The table shows the hydration factors along with the current set values and the total water contribution in mls/oz/liters of the factor.
You can reset the amount of water drank for a day by pressing the \'Reset\' button on in the bottom left.

You can save the amount of water you have drunk by clicking the \'Save\' button. The water totally will be saved at the end of each day (if the option is selected in the settings screen) or you can do it manually here.
There are numerous factors which determine how much water you should be drinking a day.
Hydromaster lets you personalise you water needs using the factors below
Your gender and weight effect how much water is required by your body to facilitate bodily functions and effects how much water you will lose out of your body every day.
Having a healthy diet can make up to 20% of your water in-take throughout the day. Tick this box if you eat plenty of fruit and vegetables, and have a varied diet.
If you are in a warmer climate you need to drink more water to make up for water lost through perspiration. Colder climates also effect the amount of water required.

Your level of activity is one of the biggest factors of the amount of water you should drink each day. As you exercise, your body losses water through prespiration and requires more water for proper replenishment. Drinking more water will help you recover from exercise more quickly.
Drinking water is vital when you are ill to help your body to recover. If you have diarrhea you lose more water from your body - it is vital this is replaced.
Women who are nursing or pregnant will need to drink more water to accommodate for the additional water loss to the baby or fetus
Drinking alcohol can seriously dehydrate the body and water need to be replaced as quickly as possible after drinking.
Drink your next glass of water at:
Welcome to Hydromaster! This app helps you manage how much water you should be drinking on a daily bases. Simply configure your hydration factors and let Hydromaster do the rest.
Water is your life source and you couldn\'t live without it!
There are so many benefits to being hydrated, from cutting the risk of disease to losing weight. The information section of this app will tell you all about them.
We\'ve set up a number of default values so you can start getting hydrated straight away. Remember to set an alarm in the settings menu to help you remember to drink more water!

The amount of water you should be drinking is determined by many factors. This configuration screen allows you to tailor these factors to find the optimal amount of water you should be drinking daily.
For example, more exercise in a warmer climate will increase the amount of water you should drink. Hydromaster wildefault_water_unitl calculate the exact amount for you!
Do you have a fever or diarrhea?
How much water do I need a day?
What does your stool look like?
Automatically save your marked daily water intake
How do I increase my daily water intake?
Start the day with a cup of hot water with a good squeeze of fresh lemon. This will give your digestive system a real boost.
Instead of caffeine and alcohol, drink water. Caffeine and alcohol act as diuretics and cause the body to lose water.
Throughout the day have water constantly available; keep a water bottle on your desk so you can top up your glass throughout the day and carry a bottle of water with you when you are on the go.
Create a daily schedule; drink a glass after breakfast, one before lunch etc. You may want to track your water intake, use iHydation to ensure that you drink enough water!
If you are cold, drink warm water instead of coffee or tea which can dehydrate you.
Ask for a glass of water to go with your coffee and tea in Cafes.
Drink a glass of water before and during each meal.
Don’t forget to eat plenty of fruit and vegetables as these have a high water content and will contribute to your daily water intake.

Water makes up about two-thirds of our body weight. And its important for this to be maintained because most of the chemical reactions that happen in our cells need water. We also need water for our blood to be able to carry nutrients around the body.

A simple question with no easy answers. Studies have produced varying recommendations over the years, but in truth, your water needs depend on many factors, including your health, how active you are and where you live. Hydromaster uses these factors to determine a recommanded amount of water for you to be drinking each day.
Water is the number one most important thing to address when it comes to losing weight, because water actually increases your bodies ability to metabolize fat. Here is how:

Your liver is the organ that deals with metabolizing fat, and your kidneys deal with straining the toxins out of the water you drink. However, if you do not have enough water in your system already, your kidneys will not be able to do their job. In this case, your body shifts some of the work over to your liver.

The idea that drinking too much water or a certain temperature of water will make you bloat is a myth. Your body bloats when it is dehydrated because it believes that you are not going to give it enough water, so it will save what is already there. The ONLY way to deal with bloating is to drink more water. Bloating is a sure sign that you are dehydrated.

It may be inconvenient at first because you will have to pee more often, but the reason that you are running to the bathroom is actually great; your body is finally letting go of all the old, toxic water that its been holding onto. The water that you are drinking is usually not the first water that you excrete after being dehydrated. Now your body knows that you will be replacing the water, so it is not panicking and storing it, it is letting go to make room for the fresh, clean water you are sending in. After a few days or a week, the bathroom trips will slow down and your body will get into a great rhythm, which includes reduced appetite, more luminous complexion, and better muscle tone, as well as a more efficient metabolism.

Increasing your water intake may cause you to have to get up in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom. To avoid this, you may want to stop drinking water a few hours before bedtime--or make sure you visit the toilet before bed!

It is possible to "overdose" on water. Water intoxication occurs when the electrolytes in the body are so diluted that they have trouble keeping the balance of water even inside and outside of individual cells. What that means is that drinking too much water (while not getting enough electrolytes) can cause your cells to burst. If you plan on doing heavy prolonged exercise, be sure to alternate sports drinks with regular water to keep your electrolytes in balance. Three glasses of water to one glass of typical sugary sports drink is ideal if you rely on sports drinks for electrolytes during very heavy prolonged exercise, such as a marathon.

People with some heart conditions, high blood pressure or swelling of the lower legs (edema) need to avoid excess water. If you have a history of kidney problems, especially if you have had a transplant, consult your doctor before increasing your fluid intakes.
You shouldn\'t drink too much water while eating as it dilutes your stomach acid and can cause digestion problems.
In some countries, tap water is dangerous and can cause diseases such as jaundice. Make sure you know whats safe and what isn\'t.
The alarm service has started running
The alarm service has finished running

The application content is not a substitute for direct, personal, professional medical care and diagnosis. None of the exercises or treatments (including products and services) mentioned at in the applciation should be performed or otherwise used without clearance from your physician or health care provider. The information contained within is not intended to provide specific physical or mental health advice, or any other advice whatsoever, for any individual or company and should not be relied upon in that regard. We are not medical professionals and nothing on this website should be misconstrued to mean otherwise.
1) Roughly 70 percent of an adult\'s body is made up of water.
2) At birth, water accounts for approximately 80 percent of an infant\'s body weight.
3) A healthy person can drink about three gallons (48 cups) of water per day.
4) Drinking too much water too quickly can lead to water intoxication. Water intoxication occurs when water dilutes the sodium level in the bloodstream and causes an imbalance of water in the brain.
5) Water intoxication is most likely to occur during periods of intense athletic performance.

6) Soft drinks, coffee, and tea, while made up almost entirely of water, also contain caffeine. Caffeine can act as a mild diuretic, preventing water from traveling to necessary locations in the body.
7) Pure water (solely hydrogen and oxygen atoms) has a neutral pH of 7, which is neither acidic nor basic.
8) Water dissolves more substances than any other liquid. Wherever it travels, water carries chemicals, minerals, and nutrients with it.
9) Much more fresh water is stored under the ground in aquifers than on the earth\'s surface.
10) The earth is a closed system, similar to a terrarium, meaning that it rarely loses or gains extra matter. The same water that existed on the earth millions of years ago is still present today.
Time for a glass of water
Below is a description of the different options available.
This screens allows you to log when you have drank a glass of water
Set your personalised hydration factors here
This screen shows how your hydration factors effect the water amount of water you should drink
This screen shows a history of logged water drank
This screen allows you to configure alarms and water measurements
This screen shows useful information and facts about water.
